notes: On 23 January 2021, between 4000 and 40000 people (likely closer to 20000) took part in a demonstration in Moscow, demanding the release of Alexei Navalny, who was sentenced to 30 days of administrative arrest after arriving from Germany, where he was recovering from a failed assassination attempt carried out by the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB). Police detained at least 1533 demonstrators, with numerous people reportedly suffering injuries, and 42 police officers reporting minor injuries. A small group of demonstrators were filmed lobbing snowballs at police and also a car with government number plates, breaking its window and reportedly damaging the driver's eye. The car reportedly belonged to the Federal Security Service. [size=4000-40000, likely closer to 20000]

On 16 August 2020, thousands of demonstrators clashed with police and private security personnel near the city of Sterlitamak over the rights to set up soda mining operations on the Kushtau hill. Opponents of the mining project cite environmental and religious reasons. Police and private security used tear gas and flashbang grenades but were not able to disperse the demonstrators, who succeeded in tearing down various fencing around the proposed build site. [size=thousands]

notes: On 28 January 2018, protest rallies were held in many Russian cities in support of the call from an opposition figure Alexey Navalny, the founder of the Progress Party, as he was denied participating in the Russian presidential elections due to the five-year suspended sentence he received in February 2017. assoc_actor_1: GI: Civic Initiative Party; Journalists (Russia)
notes: On 28 January 2018, a TV presenter and a presidential candidate for GI Ksenia Sobchak organized a sole picket protest in Chechnya's capital Grozny, supporting the detained head of the Chechnyan Memorial Oyub Titiyev. He was earlier accused of alleged possessing marijuana.

assoc_actor_1: Progress Party
notes: On 28 January 2018, reportedly up to 200 individuals took part at the 'voter-strike' rally in Veliky Novgorod, organized by the local branch of Navalny's team. Four individuals were briefly detained, because the event was alegedly not sanctioned by authorities.

assoc_actor_1: Progress Party; Students (Russia); Labour Group (Russia)
notes: On 28 January 2018, Alexei Navalny organised a demonstration in Chelyabinsk related to the presidential election. Predominantly students and pensioners attended the rally. Local authority claims only 300 individuals took place, the organisers 1500. There were many minors taken to the rally by their parents and were not allowed to join the others; the organizers later claimed that there was no age limit and their rights were violated. According to reports some participants were detained.
On 28 January 2018, there was a funeral-like rally in Magnitogorsk; bidding farewell to the presidential elections. The exact number of participants is estimated: 150 individuals.

On 28 January 2018, protestors gathered in Sochi for a demonstration against what they believed to be a fraudulent building project. The organization that organized the protest, the 'Association of Deceived Shareholders', claimed that over 200 people participated in the rally.

assoc_actor_1: RRP: Revolutionary Workers Party
notes: On 27 January 2018, members of the socialist Revolutionary Workers' party held a happening in support of the Workers' Association Interregional Trade Union (MPRA), disbanded by official authorities, as being labelled as a foreign agent. No detentions reported.
On 27 January 2018, protesters gathered in the city of Kandalaksha in a demonstration against the proposed doubling of the price of gas.

assoc_actor_1: OR: The Other Russia
notes: On 22 January 2018, six activists of the unregistered party The Other Russia (National Bolsheviks) held a protest in front of the Russian Central Election Commission in Moscow. They lit flares and souted demands to revise privatisation in 1990s. All were detained immediately.

On 19 January 2018, around 500 individuals took part at a traditional march in Moscow in memory of Stanislav Markelov and Anastasia Baburova, a lawyer and a journalist of Novaya Gazeta, both killed in 2009. According to more sources, 1-4 individuals were detained, because their faces were covered.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Russia)
notes: On 18 January 2018, miners associated with a local labour group from Gukovo held a picket protest, demanding to pay wage arrears - or at least to be provided coal to face frosty temperatures. Their employer owes the miners around 370 million roubles and already repeatedly promised to find a solution, but without any real effect. The protest was attended by 70 miners.

assoc_actor_1: Essence of Time
notes: On 15 January 2018, members of the movement Essence of Time (neo-Stalinist-oriented) held a picket protest in Krasnodar. They disagreed with a decision of a Felitsyn state museum in Krasnodar and State historical museum in Moscow not to put a label to a portrait of a Cossack representative Vyacheslav Naumenko indicating his cooperation with Nazi units. Later, the portrait was removed from the exhibition.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Russia)
notes: On 15 January 2018, almost 50 miners associated with a local labour group from Gukovo held a picket protest, demanding to pay wage arrears - or at least to be provided coal to face frosty temperatures. The Kingcoal Company in the Rostov region owes the miners around 370 million roubles.
On 15 January 2018, animal rights activists gathered for a rally in Novosibirsk in opposition to a federal decision regarding the culling of animals and defense of endangered species.

assoc_actor_1: Essence of Time
notes: On 14 January 2018, members of the movement Essence of Time (neo-Stalinist-oriented) held a picket protest in Moscow. They disagreed with a decision of a Felitsyn state museum in Krasnodar and State historical museum in Moscow not to put a label to a portrait of a Cossack representative Vyacheslav Naumenko indicating his cooperation with Nazi units. Later, the portrait was removed from the exhibition

On 14 January 2018, a protest action was held in Vladikavkaz by the family members of Vladimir Tskayev, who was beaten and killed by police between October 31st and November 1st 2015 while in custody.

On 13 January 2018, residents of Vladikavkaz municipality held a picke protest in support of the family of Vladimir Tskaev, who died in custody after police interrogation in 2015. His family claims that he was tortured and de facto killed by law enforcers. Several policemen are under investigation regarding this matter. Around 300 individuals attended.
On Janruary 10th 2018, demstrators gathered in downtown Tyumen in protest over the mismanagement and fraud in the 'Tyumen Savings Fund'.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Russia)
notes: On 6 January 2018, a demonstration against the proposed pension reform took place in Makushino municipality. The rally was organized by local trade unions, around 300 individuals participated. The organizers announced that the protests are most likely to continue.

assoc_actor_1: Anarchist Group (Russia)
notes: On 6 January 2018, protesters associated to the informal campaign 'Strategy 6' held picket protests in St Petersburg, demanding release of anarchist-activists Viktor Filinkov and Igor Sishkin (who were reportedly tortured to confess their allged crimes) as well as Ilya Kapustin and Oyub Titiev, who was detained in Chechnya. According to the organizers, the protest is most likely to continue until the prisoners are released.

On 5 January 2018, local residents of Kazan with their dogs/pets gathered in local park to protest a new legislature, according to which bear-baiting shall be prohibited in the future. Around 50 individuals participated. Around 30 000 individuals in Tatarstan hold a hunting license.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Russia)
notes: On 5 July 2018, a dozen of employees of Teatre.doc were arrested in Moscow during a peaceful picket protest in support of the arrested Ukrainian Oleg Sentsov. Reportedly, nine of them were detained due to alleged drug use and drunkness, another actress was hit, but not detained. A protester, who was filming the detention, was forced to erase the video. All were detained later in the night.
On 4 January 2018, four hunters gathered in Orenburg for a small demonstration in defense of proper hunting and dog raising regulations.
